intro: Thapsia bischoffii, commonly known as the Canary Island thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and white or pale green. Thapsia bischoffii is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
